mdRecord.dcterms:description: Poplar Forest was Thomas Jefferson's plantation and plantation house in what is now Forest, Bedford County, Virginia, near Lynchburg. He designed it and treated it as a private retreat, working on it from 1806 until his death 20 years later. Jefferson once wrote a correspondent saying "It is the most valuable of my possessions." [work]

By different owners, the main house underwent many alterations. There was a fire in 1845; the Cobbs and Hutter families chose to rebuild in the Greek revival style … The original walls, chimney, and columns remained after the renovation. The Corporation for Jefferson's Poplar Forest is using early 19th-century building materials … to restore Poplar Forest to Jefferson's original architectural vision. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poplar_Forest [work]
